body:
Parameters
----------
metadata : pandas.DataFrame, optional
    A DataFrame that contains the metadata for signals, conditions, scalars, or assets. If `metadata` is supplied,
    in conjunction with a `data` DataFrame, it has specific requirements depending on the kind of data supplied.

    Metadata for each object type includes

    Type Key: Si = Signal, Sc = Scalar, C = Condition, A = Asset

    ======================== =========================================================== =====================
    Metadata Term            Definition                                                  Applicable Types
    ======================== =========================================================== =====================
    Name                      The name of the signal                                      Si, Sc, C, A
    Description               The description of the signal                               Si, Sc, C, A
    Maximum Interpolation     The maximum interpolation between samples                   Si
    Unit of Measure           The unit of measure of the values, or keys for conditions   Si, Sc, C
    Formula                   The formula for a calculated item                           Si, Sc, C
    Formula Parameters        The parameters for a formula                                Si, Sc, C
    Interpolation Method      The interpolation method between points options are
                              (Linear, Step, PILinear)                                    Si
    Maximum Duration          The maximum expected duration for a capsule                 C
    Number Format             The formatting string for number, following ECMA-376        Si, Sc
    Path                      The asset tree path where the item's parent asset resides   Si, Sc, C, A
    Asset                     The asset that the item is to be a child of. The asset
                              must be in the tree at the specified path, or listed in
                              `metadata` for creation.                                    Si, Sc, C, A
    ======================== =========================================================== =====================

fragments.myDescription:
A DataFrame that contains the metadata for signals, conditions, scalars, or assets. If `metadata` is supplied,
in conjunction with a `data` DataFrame, it has specific requirements depending on the kind of data supplied.

Metadata for each object type includes

Type Key: Si = Signal, Sc = Scalar, C = Condition, A = Asset

======================== =========================================================== =====================
Metadata Term            Definition                                                  Applicable Types
======================== =========================================================== =====================
Name                      The name of the signal                                      Si, Sc, C, A
Description               The description of the signal                               Si, Sc, C, A
Maximum Interpolation     The maximum interpolation between samples                   Si
Unit of Measure           The unit of measure of the values, or keys for conditions   Si, Sc, C
Formula                   The formula for a calculated item                           Si, Sc, C
Formula Parameters        The parameters for a formula                                Si, Sc, C
Interpolation Method      The interpolation method between points options are
                          (Linear, Step, PILinear)                                    Si
Maximum Duration          The maximum expected duration for a capsule                 C
Number Format             The formatting string for number, following ECMA-376        Si, Sc
Path                      The asset tree path where the item's parent asset resides   Si, Sc, C, A
Asset                     The asset that the item is to be a child of. The asset
                          must be in the tree at the specified path, or listed in
                          `metadata` for creation.                                    Si, Sc, C, A
======================== =========================================================== =====================
